definition: states of south China in different historical periods/proverbially perpetual arch-enemies
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
Wu and Yue in the same boat (idiom); fig. cooperation between natural rivals/to collaborate towards a common end/in the same boat together
History of the Southern States Wu and Yue (traditional rivals), compiled by Han historian Zhao Ye 趙曄|赵晔[Zhao4 Ye4], 10 extant scrolls

sentences.english: Bo Pi is an important person in the late Spring and Autumn Period.
sentences.chinese: 伯喜否是春秋后期吴越争霸史上的重要人物之一。

sentences.english: When your father allowed you to pursue the arts, I was against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 当初先帝答应你去吴越之地学艺，我是反对的。

sentences.english: It is said that the states Wu and Yue had their boundary on this bridge.
sentences.chinese: 传说当年吴越两国就是以这座桥为界的。

sentences.english: Often want to correct, will be "Wuyuechunqiu" chronological to prepare for North and South.
sentences.chinese: 常欲改正，将拟《吴越春秋》，编年以备南北。

sentences.english: Wuyue Family not only sounds beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 吴越人家不仅仅是个好听的名字。

definition: Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
southern states of Wu and Chu/the middle and lower Yangtze valley
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
Tang of the Five Southern Dynasties 937-975
the Qin (221-207 BC) and Han (206 BC-220 AD) dynasties
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Central Plain, the middle and lower regions of the Yellow river, including Henan, western Shandong, southern Shanxi and Hebei
Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Sunwu county in Heihe 黑河[Hei1 he2], Heilongjiang
Jiangdong district of Ningbo city 寧波市|宁波市[Ning2 bo1 shi4], Zhejiang
Southern Dynasties (420-589)
King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC)/also called 闔廬|阖庐
Three Kingdoms period (220-280) in Chinese history/several Three Kingdoms periods in Korean history, esp. from 1st century AD to unification under Silla 新羅|新罗[Xin1 luo2] in 658
